results.title: Report on Eppalock
results.creator_credit: Robert Rothols, Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Lake Eppalock, and its catchment area are the base for a unique water and soil conservation scheme. The area in the past has suffered severe erosion due to gold mining and bad farming. The aims of this long term project are to heal erosion, conserve water, reclaim land and increase farming production with the co-operation of land holders, shire councils and various Government departments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Rothols, Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: [Maryborough mudbrick dome]
results.brief_description:
Film showing the construction of a mudbrick hut with domed roof in Maryborough, central Victoria. The hut sits alongside the Maryborough Centenary Reserve, just off Stoneham Drive.

The hut was constructed during a week long workshop with Melbourne arhitecture students and local sustainability enthusiasts including Bill Mollison. The project was featured in ‘The Owner Builder” issue 5 and was overseen by Nepalese architect, Ramesh Manandhar, who is interviewed in the film.

The soundtrack is intermittent.

results.title: One day at the park
results.creator_credit: Yasmin Blyth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Becoming me
results.creator_credit: Tyson Cunningham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Tyson Cunningham can’t express himself, music does it for him. Although he has long given up dreams of fronting a band like his brother, music is still everything to him, and expresses his emotional life like nothing else.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tyson Cunningham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: On a Sunday he went fishing
results.creator_credit: Sarah Mifsud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

video_links.name: On a Sunday he went fishing

results.brief_description: Sarah Mifsud’s father was an avid fisherman as was his father before him. Mifsud tells of the ordinary Sunday which turned tragically extraordinary for her family and the journey to rebuild in the aftermath.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Mifsud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Sarah Mifsud’s father was an avid fisherman as was his father before him. Mifsud tells of the ordinary Sunday which turned tragically extraordinary for her family and the journey to rebuild in the aftermath.

results.title: Ride
results.creator_credit: Matthew Hunt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Matt Hunt talks candidly about his all-consuming addiction: riding bikes. It is an obsession that has changed the way he looks at the world, cost him physically and financially but one that he is not likely to give up soon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Matthew Hunt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Bristol school
results.creator_credit: Nancy Hamilton, E.J. Perry and Victoria. Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
A look at the Victorian Department of Education’s work in importing 100 pressed aluminium building from Bristol, England. These buildings can be erected in 2 days and will provide accommodation of 8,000 students in an attempt to overcome overcrowding within Victorian schools.

The construction process is shown with one being assembled in the Melbourne University grounds near the Melbourne Teacher’s College.

The film print from which the digital copy was made was badly damaged and the digital version shows evidence of that.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nancy Hamilton, E.J. Perry and Victoria. Visual Education Centre

results.title: The Ambassador
results.brief_description:
‘The Ambassador’, is a short film featuring veteran actor, Wynn Roberts (from Picnic At Hanging Rock) as a man who writes to the Minister for the Environment to advocate for the forests and the animals that live in them.

The film is built around real events: Wynn has lived much of his 95 years in the forest. It also references climate change, ongoing logging, the staggering loss of wildlife during the recent mega fires and showcases wildlife from the southeast forests. The film won the 2020 BVSC Best Environment Film Award.

Details on Wynn Roberts can be found here - https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0731687/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

results.title: Yoram Gross : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

video_links.name: Yoram Gross : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

results.brief_description: An interview with producer Yoram Gross for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Yoram Gross founded the Yoram Gross Film Studio and was known for his work on animated films and TV series including “Blinky Bill”, the “Dot” series, and “The Magic Riddle”.
results.description: An interview with producer Yoram Gross for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Yoram Gross founded the Yoram Gross Film Studio and was known for his work on animated films and TV series including “Blinky Bill”, the “Dot” series, and “The Magic Riddle”.

results.title: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

video_links.name: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

results.brief_description: An interview with screenwriters Sue Smith and John Alsop for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Sue Smith and John Alsop are screenwriters and playwrights who have collaborated on productions such as “My Brother Jack”, “Brides of Christ”, “Bordertown” and “The Leaving of Liverpool”.
